title: Some chars not recognized in some apps
content:
I'm creating a large Unicode font (1600+ glyphs, although many are composites) with FontLab 4.5.2 under Win XP. The font functions fine with Notepad, OpenOffice Writer, and InDesign 2, and also with TextEdit and Character Palettte under Mac OS X. With Word XP and Character Map, a good number of the characters (the last 200 or so I've added, I'd guess) are just ignored. That is, they do not appear in Word's Insert/Symbol, nor in Character Map. If I type the hex value for one of these affected characters in Word, followed by Alt-X, I get a blank box. This has gone on through a few revisions now and I need to get it fixed. I'd suspect a bad cmap, or that some Unicode values were set incorrectly, but then how does it work on certain apps? I would appreciate any suggestions very much.   
   
David
author: magister
